channel.title: Excel on Paul Oldham's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Excel on Paul Oldham's Blog

item.title: An Update on Importing Excel Data in R
item.description: Introduction Import Directly from the RStudio Menu Reading an Excel file from a URL Tidying column names with janitor Exporting to Excel Round Up Introduction Back in 2015 I wrote a long blog post on importing Excel tables into R. Happily for everyone this is now a lot easier than it was. This post provides an update on importing spreadsheets into R and exporting from R to Excel.

item.title: An Update on Importing Excel Data in R

item.title: Reading and Writing an Excel File in R
item.description: This post was updated in 2018 and you can read it here The CRAN Project has the following to say about importing Excel files into R. â€œThe first piece of advice is to avoid doing so if possible! If you have access to Excel, export the data you want from Excel in tab-delimited or comma-separated form, and use read.delim or read.csv to import it into R. (You may need to use read.
